page.title: 09POTTEN END-THE POND I.
page.content:
AT POTTEN END THE GRASS AROUND THE POND IS LEFT TO GROW WILD AND ONLY FOOTPATHS ARE MAINTAINED TO ALLOW PEOPLE TO WALK AROUND THE GREEN. THE GRASS IS TO ENCOURAGE INSECTS TO VISIT AND STAY IN THEIR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT,SUCH AS THE BUTTERFLIES AND MOTHS THAT LIKE THE WILD GRASS,AND PLANTS THAT ARE LEFT TO GROW.
THERE ARE RED ADMIRALS,PEACOCKS AND TORTOISHELL BUTTERFLIES. POTTEN END POND ALSO ATTRACTS OTHER LIFE TO IT, THAT OF PEOPLE.
AT ONE SIDE OF THE POND THERE IS AVERY PICTURESQUE PUBLIC HOUSE THAT NOT ONLY THE LOCAL PEOPLE USE,BUT ALSO PEOPLE FROM THE SURROUNDING DISTRICTS. IN THE SUMMER THEY SIT OUT ON THE GREEN AND BECOME MORE AWARE OF THE ENVIRONMENT THEY ARE IN.
